page.para: Tortoise finds her house
Tortoise was looking for something.
“What are you looking for?” asked Snail.
“I’m looking for my house,” Tortoise replied. “Have you seen it?”
“No, I haven’t seen your house. But I’ll help you look!” Snail slithered onto Tortoise’s shell.
Together they searched, but they couldn’t see a house anywhere.
“What are you searching for?” Sparrow called to them.
“Have you seen Tortoise’s house?” Snail asked.
“I haven’t seen a house. But I’m happy to help you look!” Sparrow flew up into the sky.
“I can’t keep up!” Tortoise called.
Sparrow flew down. He landed behind Snail on Tortoise’s shell.
Tortoise plodded on, but there was still no sign of her house.
Mouse hadn’t seen Tortoise’s house either.
She scurried up onto Tortoise’s shell.
A breeze was beginning to blow. It lifted leaves off the ground and swirled them around Tortoise and her friends.
The sky turned dark. “Oh, where is my house?” cried Tortoise.
Lightning flashed over the hills.
Drip drop drip came the rain.
The wind whipped up and whirled Sparrow and Mouse into the air.
A clap of thunder boomed through the valley.
“Eeeek!” Tortoise cried. She shrank back into her shell with fright.
It was warm and cosy inside.
“Ah, here is my house!” Tortoise smiled. “Come and shelter beneath it!” she said to her friends.
So they sat together and waited for the storm to pass.
